titles.title: Recognizing the importance of children in the United States and supporting the goals and ideas of National Youth Day.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Mr. Goodling moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate H. Con. Res. 375.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 7/25/2000--Passed House amended. Recognizes the importance of youth to the future of the United States. Supports the goals and ideas of American Youth Day.Encourages the people of the United States to participate in local and national activities that seek to fulfill the Five Promises to America's youth, as established by America's Promise--The Alliance for Youth.
